meanings.definition: To make (something) ineffective or harmless by applying an opposite force or effect.
meanings.sent1: The lemon juice neutralizes the taste of the bitter medicine.
meanings.sent2: Adding sugar neutralizes the bitterness of the coffee.
meanings.sent3: His joke about the serious topic neutralizes the tension in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her smile neutralizes the gloominess of the rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's power to neutralize evil makes him a beloved protector of the city.

meanings.definition: To counteract or balance the effect of (something).
meanings.sent1: Eating a banana neutralizes the potassium loss from sweating.
meanings.sent2: Drinking water can neutralize the effects of dehydration.
meanings.sent3: His quick thinking neutralizes the impact of his mistake.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness neutralizes the negativity around her.
meanings.sent5: The antidote quickly neutralizes the poison in the body.

meanings.definition: To render (something) neutral in pH or acidity.
meanings.sent1: Adding baking soda neutralizes the acidity of the tomato sauce.
meanings.sent2: Lemon juice can neutralize the pH level of water.
meanings.sent3: The scientist's experiment accidentally neutralizes the solution.
meanings.sent4: The base neutralizes the acid, creating a balanced solution.
meanings.sent5: The alkaline substance effectively neutralizes the acidic compound.
